description: Know your customer, or know your client, check is a mandatory process to identify and verify customer identities to prevent and identify money laundering and other illegal activities.
Customer due diligence is a term for processes verifying a customer's background and with it a customer's identity, and assess the risk level a customer's business brings.
Technology-enabled financing mechanism based on equity claim issuance. A Rolling SAFE is a programmable equity offering.
Technology-enabled financing mechanism based on equity claim issuance. A Rolling SAFE is a programmable equity offering.

term: Rolling Simple Agreement for Future Equity
description: Blockchain technology-enabled continuous token offering, in which tokens represent a claim on future equity of the issuing organization.
Blockchain technology-enabled continuous token offering, in which tokens represent a claim on future equity of the issuing organization.
Or share repurchase, is a term to describe when a company buys its outstanding shares to reduce the number of shares on the market.
Or convertible bond, is a bond type that can be converted into a number of shares of common stock or equal cash value.
A financing round in which investors purchase a fixed size of equity (stock) in a company, the size is pre-defined.
Net amount of cash and cash equivalents being moved/transferred in and out of a company.
Way in which a company or project receives the financial means (funding) needed to remain operational.
Describes the the availability of liquid assets to a market or company, i.e. how fast an asset can be sold and bought without a strong price increase or decrease.
Financial mechanisms with faster financing rounds to prevent deadlocks and long processes as in the case of fixed-size equity round. Example: Convertible notes.
Financial mechanisms based on investor funding.
A value reduction of existing shares after additional shares of stock (equity) are issued and investor's ownership of a company.
The token of the TZMINT educational sample application.
The target amount of the investment offering.
The target amount of the investment offering.
Mathematical function describing the relationship between price and supply of an asset.

Or liquidity provider, a company or an individual that buys and sells securities (tradable assets) held in tehir own inventory to profit from bid-ask spreds (amount by which the ask price exceeds the bid price).
Private equity investor that provides companies in their early stages with capital because of the company's growth potential.

Initial coin offering, or initial currency offering, when a company raises capital by selling a cryptocurrency, which investors buy expecting a value increase of the cryptocurrency, or to exchange the cryptocurrency for services offered at a later point of time.

Initial coin offering, or initial currency offering, when a company raises capital by selling a cryptocurrency, which investors buy expecting a value increase of the cryptocurrency, or to exchange the cryptocurrency for services offered at a later point of time.

Initial public offering, or stock launch, a public share offering to institutional investors (entities that pool money, like a commercial bank or hedge funds) and also retail investors (individual investors trading secuirties in smaller amounts).

Initial public offering, or stock launch, a public share offering to institutional investors (entities that pool money, like a commercial bank or hedge funds) and also retail investors (individual investors trading secuirties in smaller amounts).
Entities that pool money, like a commercial bank or hedge funds.
When a token holder wants to "sell" his tokens back to the smart contract, which are then burned (destroyed) and no longer available in an open market.
